anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch4681 [Nodoka] and http://anidb.net/ch4685 [Yue] are practising their spell casting, when Yue casts the Red String of Fate spell on Nodoka. A spell that supposedly shows them who they are fated to be with. As it turns out, the string connects Nodoka with http://anidb.net/ch4675 [Negi]. Unfortunately, this spell is not a connection of fate though, but just connects two people with a red string. And so Nodoka and Negi spend the day trying to take a bath, while their hands are tied together... Source: ANN

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: harem
tag.description: Harem is an entertainment-related trope which is characterized by three or more characters, normally female, who for some reason are in the presence and under the influence of one character, generally male, according to a few genre-defining guidelines; here it will be assumed, for simplicity of language, that the harem lead is a male character and the members are female characters. Though that is the rule, there are exceptions; a story in which there is one female character and several male characters is normally called a "http://anidb.net/t2792 [reverse harem]", or sometimes also "male harem". Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. It is also possible to create harems with homosexual relationships, again with very few changes to the main antics themselves. The harem may not have more than only one lead, as that would be a love polygon, or less than three members, as one would form a couple and two would make a love triangle. As a defining rule of harem, the interactions between the lead and each of the individual members are filled with romantically or sexually loaded content, either implicitly, through innuendo or subtext, or explicitly, through text or actions, and those actions are a key plot element. Generally, the female characters` looks and personalities will vary a lot among the ones present in one single series, but quite rarely will they actually differ from the common stock archetypes, which are known, well-defined, and easy to copy; for this reason, the genre as a whole is often considered repetitive. Usually, the characters involved directly in this trope are in the late teenager to young adult age range, but that is not mandatory. Sexually charged behavior on the lead`s part pretty much can`t be avoided, and it`s typical to see him stamped as a pervert by some or all of the members, regardless of whether he is one; the sexual tones also applies to the depiction of the harem members, often leading the genre to labeled sexist. The lead will often suffer very violent retribution for his behavior, which has attracted criticism of gratuitous violence as well. Most of the harem members will be romantically or sometimes sexually interested in the one male character, and in him alone; that, however, is not an absolute rule, and indeed sometimes none of the female characters are really interested at first, so the protagonist has to build relationships with them from scratch. That idea comes in large part from visual novels; it is quite common for visual novels to revolve around controlling the male lead and have him build relationships with either as many female characters as possible or with one of them, the latter being more common for visual novels with branched story paths; a large portion of those visual novels also feature erotic content, which may be hard to adapt to TV series. It may be also possible that the harem is only a support to the existing or predictable relationship between the lead and the most important member; additionally, the lead may end up in relationships with most or all of the harem members, with the agreement of all, in a setting normally called "harem ending".

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Negi Springfield
character.description: 9-year-old prodigy Negi Springfield has a bachelor`s degree and magical powers, but he`s sadly unprepared for his newest challenge! teaching English to a class full of teenage girls! A soft-spoken and kind lad, Negi wants to do well in his new position and he just might if he can quit crossing hot-headed rabble-rouser Asuna. He`s still got some kinks to work out in his spell casting and his lesson plan, but Negi`s a good kid with a great heart. Most of the girls instantly take to him, though he may need to keep some distance. And if any of the students find out about his wizardly training, he`ll be transformed into a furry ermine!

character.name: Albert Chamomile
character.description: Negi`s friends come in all shapes and sizes, occasionally even small, furry, foul mouthed, with a cigarette habit and a penchant for panty stealing! The little white weasel is invaluable as a confidant to Springfield, and Chamo is an integral part of some of Negi`s biggest battles and plans. Chamo spends a lot of time prodding the lad into pactios with the girls in 2-A. Of course, since the magic spells involve the young sorcerer getting a kiss, you can never really tell if Chamo is trying to help strengthen Negi`s chances as a warrior or if he`s just trying to get Springfield some romance in his life. Knowing Chamo, it`s probably both!

character.name: Kagurazaka Asuna
character.description: Asuna Kagurazaka`s mouth may be big, but her attitude is bigger. A quick tempered redhead with a tough exterior, Asuna`s brash personality serves her well in her constant struggles with her class rival, Ayaka. Asuna usually reserves her softer side for the unrequited longings she expresses toward Professor Takahata, her former teacher. It doesn`t sit well when the manly object of her affection is replaced with a new instructor! Little Negi Springfield. Her misfortunes seem to stack up when the kid is around, and her hostility and suspicion toward the brainy boy lead her to a startling discovery! She soon finds Negi`s destiny in her hands. Will she take the steps to make the magician to disappear?

character.name: Miyazaki Nodoka
character.description: Hiding from the world behind a sheet of hanging bangs, mousy bookworm Nodoka is painfully shy, especially around men. Rather than face Negi Springfield, the newest professor at Mahora Academy, Nodoka would probably prefer to vanish into the school`s vast library forever. Something is stirring in the quiet girl, though! something she cannot explain. Whatever these odd feelings, they are tied to Negi; if the lass could ever untie her tongue, perhaps a special relationship with the little magi awaits!

character.name: Aisaka Sayo
character.description: Expelled, staying home sick, a printing mistake on the class roll! The girls of 2-A can think of a thousand reasons why none of them have met Aizaka Sayo at school. But, Sayo`s been there all along! and longer! A ghost stuck for 60 years at Mahora after an accidental demise, Sayo is a melancholy observer of the crazy goings on in 2-A. Life is a hazy memory, and until Kazumi looks into it, Sayo doesn`t recall her death. With a little help from the class reporter, the little spirit might finally be able to participate in some of the fun she has had to witness from the sidelines! and from the other side!

character.name: Akashi Yuuna
character.description: An athletic girl who plays basketball and is often seen together with Makie, Ako, and Akira (i.e. the sports clubs group). Her father is Professor Akashi, one of the Mage-teachers at the Academy. She is very close to him, to the point of feeling jealousy about other women. Despite this fact, she knows nothing about magic herself.

character.name: Asakura Kazumi
character.description: Outgoing Kazumi Asakura is the resident ace reporter of 2-A. The spunky news-hound is always ready with a camera to capture the action, and definitely knows a hot scoop when she sees one! Upon discovering the name Sayo Asakura on the class roll, the redhead decides to dig up the dirt on her seemingly missing classmate. The story she finds might cause her to rethink her paparazzi style. Even better, what the intrepid reporter uncovers might finally release the mysterious Sayo from her strange wallflower limbo!

character.name: Ayase Yue
character.description: Dry and deadpan, slacker Yue is best friends with Nodoka and Haruna. Often prodding Nodoka into escalating her tense relationship with Negi, Yue supports her buddy to the point of sometimes complicating matters. A lover of books, though a pretty indifferent student, Yue is the leader of the Dummy Force; the group of five girls from 2-A with the lowest grades. There is a chance that Yue has the slight tingling of feelings for Negi, but her loyalty to Nodoka helps keep her emotions in check.

character.name: Izumi Ako
character.description: A shy athletic girl. She does not consider herself anyone special and is one of the better-behaved members of the class. She has some talent with a bass guitar. Despite working as a nurse assistant, she has a fear of seeing blood. She has a large scar across her back, which she makes every effort to hide from others and is the source of her low self-confidence, as she believes that the mark makes her ugly and unwanted.

character.name: Ookouchi Akira
character.description: A tall, athletic, and very quiet girl in the swimming club. She is so good at swimming that the Mahora High School swimming club is already looking to recruit her. She is a friend of Makie, Ako, and Yuna, although she is not always comfortable with Yuna`s stunts (for example, being forced to dress as a bunny-girl).

character.name: Kakizaki Misa
character.description: The leader of the class` cheerleaders, Madoka and Sakurako, and a member of the chorus club. She loves shopping and hates carbonated drinks. She also has a fondness for karaoke. Misa also has some "adult" tendencies, far more than any of the other girls in the class. She also likes to tease the Narutaki twins; she thinks that their reaction is "cute". She is the only girl in the class to have a steady boyfriend. Misa also enjoys dressing up Negi or other classmates in embarrassing outfits, including turning Negi into a kitsune female and several costumes for Ako to send to "Nagi Springfield".

character.name: Kasuga Misora
character.description: A hyperactive tomboy in the track and field club, who had rivalled Asuna in the class sprint runs. She always wears a crucifix and is sometimes seen wearing a nun`s habit.

character.name: Karakuri Chachamaru
character.description: Some girls get their ears pierced; some of them get missile launchers installed! At first glance it might be hard to notice that Chachamaru is anything more than Evangeline`s robotic minion, but there`s more to this lass than silicon and bolts. Her reputation outside of the school is far different than what Negi could have imagined. When the little magi and Asuna set out to battle the girly automaton, Negi must second-guess his plan to disable her. In the end, the computer in Chachamaru`s head just might lose out to her very human-seeming heart.

character.name: Kugimiya Madoka
character.description: The serious one of the three cheerleaders in the class. She makes sure that the other cheerleaders (especially Sakurako) do not get into any trouble. She likes gyuudon and silver accessories and generally into Western music (currently is a fan of Avril Lavigne from notes), but hates playboys and is mildly obsessed with her husky voice. Her surname is usually the target of nickname making (which Madoka does not like) from her classmates.

character.name: Kuu Fei
character.description: The silly, fun-loving Chinese warrior girl of the class. Although appearing to be an idiot who seems to speak more with her fists than with her mind, Kuu`s abilities are top-notch making her one of the more dangerous students in the class. Becoming an early trusted ally of Negi Springfield (as well as a member of his "Baka Rangers"), she also teaches him the means of her arts in order to help him progress in his own training. She is also infamous with her appetite and her obsession with nikuman from fellow "Chinese" classmate Chao Lingshen.

character.name: Konoe Konoka
character.description: Konoka is about as sweet and kind as girl can be. A supportive and teasing best friend and room-mate to Asuna, Konoka is one of the first pupils to warm up to Negi by offering him the chance to move-in with her and Bells. The granddaughter of Mahora`s Dean Konoe, Konoka carries within her a big secret and must be protected by a hidden guardian in class. Lately, her childhood pal Setsuna has been giving her the cold shoulder. What`s behind the friction?

character.name: Saotome Haruna
character.description: A bookish cohort of Yue and Nodoka in the Library Explorers Club, Haruna is a bit of a rumourmonger. She can often be found holding a saucy manga under her arm; sometimes one of her own creation! Fancying herself a matchmaker, Haruna assists Yue in pushing Nodoka toward a confession of her desire for Negi.

character.name: Sakurazaki Setsuna
character.description: It`s the quiet ones you have to watch out for and intense Setsuna Sakurazaki is definitely a girl worth keeping an eye on. A childhood friend of class sweetie Konoka, Sakurazaki has been forcing distance between the former buddies and Konoka can`t figure out why. While on a class trip to Kyoto, Negi begins to suspect that not all is what it seems with Setsuna. It seems the girl is privy to some very secret knowledge. A kendo expert and apparent magic user as sharp and lethal as a polished blade, Setsuna lurks in the shadows for a reason! and when Konoka is attacked, Sakurazaki is obviously involved! Will she turn out to be a trusted ally or a dangerous foe?

character.name: Sasaki Makie
character.description: An energetic (and rather childish) rhythmic gymnast and one of the more prominent of the Sports Girls in the class. Although interested in cute things such as teacher Negi Springfield, her encounters with him lead her to become connected to various magical and supernatural phenomenon without truly knowing anything going on. Her connections with Negi also drive her into occasional confrontations with fellow Negiholic Ayaka Yukihiro.

character.name: Shiina Sakurako
character.description: The most cheerful of the three cheerleaders in the class. She likes Negi, but only because she thinks he is cute. She loves karaoke and her pet cats, Cookie and Biscuit (translated as Kukki and Bikke in katakana) and is in the lacrosse club. As a hobby, Sakurako gambles a lot (it was probably a habit instilled in her younger days).

character.name: Tatsumiya Mana
character.description: She is the daughter of the keepers of the Tatsumiya shrine (which is on campus), and works part-time there as a priestess (miko) and exorcist, employing guns with spellbreaker bullets as her tool of exorcism. She is not particularly sociable, keeping to herself most of the time and not engaging in conversation. She is a skinflint, and does not readily spend money unless she has to, or if there is a way to get a discount. She is also a mercenary, and mostly takes on contracts that pertain to hunting/destroying/exorcising demons and ghosts but will take on any job as long as she is paid well.

character.name: Chao Lingshen
character.description: Lingshen Chao is the type of techie that will someday create a robot that designs a program which builds a computer capable of curing the common cold! but, for now her research is limited to Electro-Umbrellas and water-proofing her classmate Chachamaru.An opportunity arises, though, for her to help right a wrong. All the tinkering in Mahora`s labs may finally pay-off if the newest project Lingshen has created with Satomi works like it should!

character.name: Nagase Kaede
character.description: When Negi retreats to the woods to gather his thoughts after a shocking confrontation with one of his students, the little magi is surprised to run into yet another of his charges, Kaede Nagase! Exuding a Zen-like calm and a maturity well beyond her years (not just because of her much discussed bust!), Kaede spends her free time training in the forested mountains. Exactly what she is training for, she will not tell. But at least she`s good at keeping information under wraps, because she soon figures out Negi`s magical secret! With Kaede`s wisdom and guidance, Negi may just be able to grasp some hidden truths! Springfield may be the teacher, but Kaede is responsible for the lessons today.

character.name: Naba Chizuru
character.description: A gentle, motherly, and loving, yet strange girl (she seems to have a problem with people calling her "old"). She is a kind person to everyone, volunteers at the daycare center in Mahora City and is in the Astronomy club. She is a good cook, and has exceptional domestic skills. Even though she is very nice, she can be sometimes be equally scary.

character.name: Narutaki Fuuka
character.description: The prankster twins Fuka and Fumika are some of the smallest and, frankly, most immature girls in 2-A. Their youthful nature might be the reason that the duo get along with Negi so well. After setting a booby trap on Springfield`s first day as a teacher, the Narutaki twins set quite a precedent of unpredictability for the lad. Fans of loooooong campus tours as members of Mahora`s Walking Club, you can often find the twins goofing around with their friend Kaede. Fumika tends to go along with her older and more outspoken sister Fuka`s plans, but make no mistake! Both of these girls are capable of trouble!

character.name: Narutaki Fumika
character.description: The prankster twins Fuka and Fumika are some of the smallest and, frankly, most immature girls in 2-A. Their youthful nature might be the reason that the duo get along with Negi so well. After setting a booby trap on Springfield`s first day as a teacher, the Narutaki twins set quite a precedent of unpredictability for the lad. Fans of loooooong campus tours as members of Mahora`s Walking Club, you can often find the twins goofing around with their friend Kaede. Fumika tends to go along with her older and more outspoken sister Fuka`s plans, but make no mistake! Both of these girls are capable of trouble!

character.name: Hakase Satomi
character.description: Working with Lingshen, Satomi Hakase spends her days creating amazing technologies, some impractical! some genius! When the young scientist and her brainy cohort create a time-machine, a world of opportunity opens up at the perfect moment. Combining Negi`s magic and Satomi`s tech savvy, there may be a chance to correct one of the greatest tragedies to ever strike 2-A. It`s going to be risky, but Satomi`s research is sound! usually!

character.name: Hasegawa Chisame
character.description: Chisame is a cynical observer of the odd goings on in 2-A, placing herself above the standard zaniness inherent of a gaggle of teenaged girls being led by a preteen boy. Her classmates view her as reserved and surly... though the rest of the world may have a slightly different opinion. When Chisame retires to her room and whips off the nerdy glasses, she leads a surprising double-life as the legendary net idol Chiu! Using her computer smarts and web savvy, Chisame rides a wave of sexy costumes and online journals to the #1 spot in internet popularity polls! That is, until a group of cute and fresh contenders makes quite a stir with their new homepage!

character.name: Evangeline Athanasia Kitty McDowell
character.description: Evangeline Athanasia Kitty McDowell is a student in 2-A, but also an ageless, centuries-old, true-blooded vampire on whom the Thousand Master, http://anidb.net/ch11898 [Nagi Springfield], used a powerful curse. Now that his young and inexperienced son, http://anidb.net/ch4675 [Negi Springfield], is close at hand as her homeroom teacher, she sets out to draw his blood in order to lift the curse, which binds her to Mahora Academy perpetually and keeps her from exercising her enormous magical powers.

character.name: Murakami Natsumi
character.description: A sweet yet shy girl who is an actress in the theatrical club. She loves acting but dislikes her ad-libs as well as her own appearance because her body is not very `mature`-looking.

character.name: Yukihiro Ayaka
character.description: A pretty girl with a palatial estate, Class President Ayaka might seem like a girl to be envied! But a lot of her peers don`t know the sadness she holds in her heart after the loss of a family member early in life. Ayaka`s lifelong rival Asuna knows her secret and surprisingly takes steps to bring some joy into the blonde`s life. Of course, that joy also comes with a visit from a rambunctious group of junior high girls who end up wreaking havoc at her fancy home. A good student and a slight control-freak, Ayaka maintains a crush on Negi that often ends up putting the lad in some uncomfortable situations!

character.name: Yotsuba Satsuki
character.description: A gentle cook. She enjoys cooking and is in the cooking club. She also cooks at Chao Bao Zi, a restaurant operated out of a streetcar that sells meat buns and other foods with Chao, Hakase, Ku, and Chachamaru. She is also the school dining officer. A very nice and hard-working person, Satsuki is liked by everyone in Mahora, even Evangeline (who sees the rest of the class as a pack of air-headed beasts) and Nitta (who views the middle school students, especially the ones from 3-A, as rowdy kids who need to be disciplined at all times). Her very presence creates an atmosphere of serenity, and she can quickly put a stop to fights even between the hot-headed students in the High School and University martial arts clubs. Satsuki`s dream is to have her own restaurant, as she likes making people happy through her food.

character.name: Zazie Rainyday
character.description: A silent acrobat, and one of the most mysterious girls of the class. Nothing much is known about her, as she rarely associates with anybody, and even when she does, she rarely talks.
